channel.title: Copyright Violation?
channel.description: Hey guys. I've been wanting to create my own Black Mesa T-shirt for a while now. The thing is, though, is that it would include the Black Mesa logo, which is no doubt copyrighted. My question: would making a custom shirt that used the Black Mesa logo be a copyright violation if I did not intend to profit from it? Thanks.

item.title: Copyright Violation?
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
I actually tried to get a black mesa mug with a personalized saying on it along with the black mesa source logo on in. The company denied my money saying the logo was copywrite. I was like “but um… I am on the actual development team… it is kinda MY logo… now gimme my damn mug!”

They never replied. Christmas last year sucked as a result.

Read full topic

item.title: Copyright Violation?
item.dc:creator: CaptainBane
item.description:
Ah, great. Thank you, gentleman.

Read full topic

item.title: Copyright Violation?
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
you’re supposed to get into legal trouble for that.

but you can find about 300 different cafepress/zazzle/ebay shops doing exactly what you’re thinking, and for profit

Read full topic

item.title: Copyright Violation?
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
It’s only if you’re selling it that you should be wary. You could get sued big time if you produce them for sale.

Read full topic

item.title: Copyright Violation?
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
If you’re making it to wear yourself (which is what I think you mean?) there’s no copyright violation. This applies to anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Copyright Violation?

item.description:
Hey guys.
I’ve been wanting to create my own Black Mesa T-shirt for a while now. The thing is, though, is that it would include the Black Mesa logo, which is no doubt copyrighted.
